item.title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today

Date: 17 Jan, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Jio Financial Services is set to announce its Q3 results today, with the share price hovering flat after a significant drop in the past month. The company has experienced a 17% decrease in its stock over the last month, although it has gained 15% over the past year.

  • The stock has fallen 18% in one month.
  • Jio Financial Services reported a net profit of ₹689 crore for Q2FY25.
  • Revenue from operations rose 14% YoY to ₹693.5 crore in Q2FY25.
  • The firm has a market capitalization exceeding ₹1.76 lakh crore.
  • Analysts suggest the stock may be bottoming out and advise buying on dips.
“Jio Finance stock seems to be bottoming out. Traders can buy the stock on dips and at current market price. The first target is ₹300 and the second target is ₹305.” - Ganesh Dongre, Senior Manager - Technical Research at Anand Rathi

In conclusion, Jio Financial Services is expected to play a significant role in the non-banking finance sector. Investors are advised to observe the Q3 results closely, which are likely to influence the stock price moving forward.

item.title: Kia Syros Showcased At Auto Expo 2025 Ahead Of Launch In February - CarDekho
item.description:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: Kia Syros Showcased to the Public Ahead of Launch

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros made its debut at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, showcasing its boxy design and upmarket features ahead of its launch in February 2025.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros are open for a token amount of Rs 25,000.
  • Price announcement on February 1, 2025, with deliveries starting mid-February.
  • Exterior features include 3-pod LED headlights and L-shaped LED tail lights.
  • Equipped with dual 12.3-inch screens and a panoramic sunroof.
  • Safety features include 6 airbags and a 360-degree camera.
  • Available with a 1-litre turbo-petrol or a 1.5-litre diesel engine.
  • Expected starting price at Rs 9.70 lakh (ex-showroom).

The Kia Syros is positioned between the Kia Sonet and Kia Seltos in India.

This new SUV is expected to attract attention with its features and specifications, positioning itself well in the competitive SUV market.

item.title: India is staring at an 'oil shock' as U.S. sanctions on Russian crude loom - CNBC
item.description:
India Faces Potential Oil Shock Due to U.S. Sanctions on Russian Crude

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: CNBC

India may soon face increased inflation and oil supply challenges due to U.S. sanctions targeting Russian energy companies.

  • U.S. sanctions on Russian oil transport may impact India's oil imports significantly.
  • India imported 40% of its oil from Russia, with expectations of price increases due to limited supply.
  • Impact on Indian refiners is likely to be severe, given the dependency on Russian crude.
  • India's oil consumption is projected to surpass China's by 2025, adding urgency to the situation.
“If India were to fully comply with U.S. sanctions, we could see a sharp decline in Russian crude arrivals in February and potentially March.” - Muyu Xu, Kpler

The ongoing situation highlights India's vulnerability to fluctuations in global oil markets and the potential for domestic economic strain.

item.title: 'Something Wrong In ED' : ASG SV Raju Disowns ED's Affidavit, Says It's Filed Without Verification;... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Counter-Affidavit in Supreme Court

Date: January 17, 2023 | Source: Supreme Court proceedings

Additional Solicitor General SV Raju raised concerns regarding a counter-affidavit filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), claiming it was submitted without proper verification and consultation.

  • SV Raju describes the ED's affidavit as "half-baked" and questions its legitimacy.
  • He accuses the ED of filing the affidavit without verifying facts or consulting the investigatory agency.
  • The Supreme Court bench, comprising Justices Oka and Bhuyan, expressed surprise at these claims.
  • The ASG intends to investigate further and has requested a departmental inquiry into the matter.
  • Justice Oka questioned how the affidavit could be filed without proper instructions from the ED.
“There is something fishy in the filing of the affidavit that is what I found yesterday.” - ASG SV Raju

This situation highlights serious procedural concerns within the ED regarding the submission of legal documents.

item.title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: Tata Sierra Revealed At Auto Expo 2025, Launch Expected Later This Year - CarDekho
item.description:
Tata Sierra Revealed at Auto Expo 2025 - Launch Expected Later This Year

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: CarDekho.com

The Tata Sierra has made a comeback in its internal combustion engine (ICE) variant at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, showcasing modern design elements while retaining its classic silhouette.

  • The Sierra ICE features an all-new design language, closely resembling its electric counterpart but with alterations to the grille and bumper.
  • Key exterior highlights include connected LED DRLs, flush-type door handles, and connected LED tail lights.
  • The interior is more advanced than that of the Harrier and Safari, featuring three screens on the dashboard.
  • Amenities include a panoramic sunroof, ventilated front seats, and three 12.3-inch screens.
  • Safety features include 6 airbags as standard, a 360-degree camera, and ADAS.
  • Expected to utilize 1.5-litre turbo-petrol and 2-litre diesel engines.
  • Potential pricing starts from Rs 10.50 lakh (ex-showroom).
The Tata Sierra, one of the most iconic brand names in Tata Motors’ history, returns with modern enhancements while honoring its legacy.

In conclusion, the Tata Sierra ICE promises to be a significant addition to Tata’s SUV lineup, blending nostalgia with advanced automotive technology.

item.title: 'Time to book profits', an analyst advises on this Nifty 50 stock - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Time to book profits, an analyst advises on this Nifty 50 stock

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Kotak Institutional Equities has downgraded Tata Group's Trent Ltd. to a 'sell' rating, citing that the expected revenue and EPS growth is already priced into the stock.

  • Kotak downgraded Trent's rating from 'add' to 'sell'.
  • New price target set at ₹5,850, down from ₹6,800, implying a 6% downside.
  • Trent's shares have corrected 25% from their all-time high of ₹8,345.
  • Analyst warns about potential revenue cannibalization from closely located Zudio stores.
  • Revenue and EPS estimates cut by 1-2% and 9-14% respectively for FY 2025-2027.
  • Trent shares have consistently provided positive returns every calendar year for the last decade.
"After the fantastic run-up in the stock price, it may be time to book profits," - Kotak Institutional Equities

Shares of Trent rose 0.8% on Friday, currently at ₹6,259, but have fallen 10% in the past month.

Despite the downgrade, Trent is expected to maintain a healthy revenue CAGR of 29% and EPS CAGR of 35% over the next few years, but Kotak believes these figures are already accounted for in the stock price.

item.title: PM Modi to launch Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, the 2nd edition to witness over 100 launches of automobiles - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Launches Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, set to showcase over 100 new launches in the automobile sector, including components and technologies.

  • The expo will last five days at multiple venues, including Bharat Mandapam and Greater Noida.
  • PM Modi highlighted the impact of infrastructure spending on vehicle demand.
  • He emphasized India's need for advanced mobility solutions and sustainable technologies.
  • The automotive industry is projected to experience significant growth in electric vehicle sales.
  • Over 5 lakh visitors and 5,100 international participants are expected to attend.
“In the last decade, EV sales have seen a 640% growth. By the end of the decade, EV sales are projected to grow by 8 times.” – PM Modi

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 aims to drive innovation and growth in India's mobility sector.

item.title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launch bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 on January 17, 2025 - The Hindu
item.description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Inaugurate Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the second edition of the Bharat Mobility Global Expo on January 17, 2025, showcasing over 100 new launches in the automotive sector.

  • The expo will feature a wide range of participants from the mobility ecosystem including automobile manufacturers, component producers, and software firms.
  • It aims to promote collaboration and innovation in sustainable automotive technology.
  • The event will take place across three venues: Bharat Mandapam, Yashobhoomi, and India Expo Centre & Mart.
  • It is expected to attract over 5 lakh visitors and includes significant launches from major automotive companies.
Overall, more than 40 new product launches are expected at this main attraction of Bharat Mobility Global Expo, 2025.

This expo will be an important platform to highlight advancements in electric vehicles and new innovations in the industry.

Stock market today: BSE Sensex down over 450 points; Nifty50 below 23,200

Publication Date: Today Source: Times of India

The stock market experienced a significant decline today, with the BSE Sensex falling over 450 points and the Nifty50 dipping below the 23,200 mark.

  • The BSE Sensex fell to significant lows, impacting investor sentiment.
  • The Nifty50 index also showed a downward trend, falling below a critical threshold.

"The markets are reacting to ongoing economic uncertainties and investors are advised to stay cautious."

This downturn in the stock market illustrates the ongoing volatility and economic challenges currently faced.

item.title: SpaceX Starship test flight 7 explodes: What went wrong with Elon Musk's rocket? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
SpaceX Starship Test Flight 7 Explodes: What Went Wrong with Elon Musk's Rocket?

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

SpaceX's Starship rocket exploded just minutes into its seventh test flight, marking an unexpected setback for the company as it continued to advance the vehicle's capabilities.

  • The Starship rocket exploded eight minutes after liftoff from South Texas, carrying mock satellites and no crew.
  • Preliminary indications suggest the explosion was due to an oxygen leak above the engine firewall.
  • The incident caused disruptions to airline flights over the Gulf of Mexico due to falling debris.
  • Elon Musk indicated that this failure will prompt reviews to prevent future occurrences, including the addition of fire suppression systems.
  • This was the seventh Starship test since 2023 as part of a broader objective to enable human and cargo missions to Mars.
“Preliminary indication is that we had an oxygen/fuel leak in the cavity above the ship engine firewall that was large enough to build pressure in excess of the vent capacity.” - Elon Musk

The explosion represents a significant setback for SpaceX, yet Musk remains optimistic about conducting a new launch soon, aiming to avoid similar failures.

item.title: ‘Flying Beast’ Gaurav Taneja gets rejected on Shark Tank India, called ‘terrible entrepreneur’ by Anupam Mittal - Hindustan Times
item.description:
YouTuber Gaurav Taneja Rejected on Shark Tank India, Criticized by Anupam Mittal

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Popular YouTuber Gaurav Taneja, known as Flying Beast, faced rejection from Shark Tank India while pitching his fitness brand, BeastLife. Despite impressive sales figures, Taneja was criticized for his entrepreneurial skills.

  • Taneja sought ₹1 crore for a 1% equity stake in BeastLife, a brand focusing on protein supplements.
  • He reported sales of ₹1 crore within an hour of launching his product website.
  • Anupam Mittal labeled Taneja a “terrible entrepreneur,” citing his divided attention between influencer work and business.
  • Mittal emphasized the importance of full-time commitment for entrepreneurial success.
  • Taneja later clarified that his sales figure referred to revenue, not profit.
Anupam Mittal stated, “You are a good influencer, but you can’t outsource entrepreneurship.”

The rejection was a significant moment for Taneja, who attempted to balance his influencer role with his entrepreneurial ambitions.

item.title: Indus Towers Share Price: CLSA adds another stock to its 'high-conviction outperform' list - CNBCTV18
item.description:
CLSA Adds Indus Towers to 'High-Conviction Outperform' List

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBCTV18

Indus Towers Ltd. shares are poised for attention as global brokerage CLSA has included the stock in its 'high-conviction outperformance' list with a newly set price target of ₹575 per share, the highest among analysts.

  • CLSA maintains an 'outperform' rating for Indus Towers.
  • The company's overdue payments from Vodafone Idea have decreased by over 70%.
  • CLSA notes that lower overdues bolster confidence in future 4G/5G network investments.
  • Indus Towers projects a 10% CAGR in EBITDA and a 7% FCF yield by FY 2027.
  • Separately, UBS upgraded Indus Towers to 'Buy' with a price target of ₹425.
  • Of 24 analysts covering the stock, 13 recommend 'Buy', five 'Sell', and six 'Neutral'.
  • Indus Towers shares fell 0.77% to ₹354.50 on the previous day, but have risen 68% in the last year.
"Lower overdues are adding confidence to planned 4G/5G network investments," CLSA.

This inclusion by CLSA, along with positive analyst actions, could signal favorable prospects for Indus Towers as it navigates its financial landscape.

item.title: Apple brings Store app to Indian market - TechCrunch
item.description:
Apple brings Store app to Indian market

Publication Date: October 27, 2023 | Source: TechCrunch

Apple launched its dedicated Apple Store app in India on Friday, deepening its retail presence in the world’s most populous country as it seeks to capitalize on growing consumer demand.

  • The app is available for download on India’s App Store, allowing customers to purchase Apple products and receive personalized shopping recommendations.
  • Users can customize their Mac and arrange for delivery or pickup of their purchases.
  • This move comes as Apple opened its first physical stores in Mumbai and Delhi in 2023 and plans to open four additional stores in various cities.
“At Apple, our customer is at the centre of everything we do, and we are thrilled to introduce the Apple Store app to reach even more users in India, further deepening our connections,” said Karen Rasmussen, Apple’s head of retail online.

Apple is focusing on increasing its footprint in India, which is the world’s second-largest smartphone market, as part of its strategy to diversify manufacturing bases beyond China.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 17: Tech Mahindra, RIL, Infosys, Wipro, LTIMindtree, Jio Financial, Axis Bank, Havells, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 17: Key Earnings and Market Outlook

Date: January 17, 2024 | Source: Financial News

The domestic equity market is anticipated to open lower today, with various major companies reporting their quarterly earnings.

  • Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL): Reported a net profit of ₹18,540 crore, up 7.4% year-over-year.
  • Axis Bank: Standalone net profit increased 4% to ₹6,304 crore.
  • LTIMindtree: Experienced a 7.14% decline in net profit to ₹1,085.4 crore.
  • Infosys: Net profit rose 11.46% to ₹6,806 crore, with an upward revenue guidance revision.
  • Upcoming Earnings: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, SBI Life, and Jio Financial Services are also set to announce results today.
“Our strong revenue growth sequentially in a seasonally weak quarter... is a clear reflection of the success of our differentiated digital offerings,” - Salil Parekh, CEO of Infosys.

This reporting period highlights the resilience and challenges faced by key players in the Indian market.

item.title: Q3 results today: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Jio Financial Services, SBI Life, others to announce earnings; check list - Upstox
item.description:
Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Jio Financial Services, SBI Life to Announce Q3 Earnings Today

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Upstox

Today, several key companies will reveal their financial results for the third quarter of the fiscal year, including major players in technology, finance, and insurance sectors.

  • Wipro Ltd
  • Tech Mahindra Ltd
  • Jio Financial Services Ltd
  • SBI Life Insurance Company Ltd
  • ICICI Lombard General Insurance Company Ltd
  • Others including Tata Chemicals and Rajoo Engineers
Reliance Industries posted a 7.4% increase in its December quarter net profit, supported by a rebound in retail business.

This financial reporting day is significant as it reflects the performance of various sectors and can indicate economic trends based on the earnings reported.

item.title: Infosys CEO asked about low salary hikes, toxic work culture. His response - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Infosys CEO Addresses Salary Hikes and Work Culture Concerns

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Infosys CEO Salil Parekh addressed employee concerns about the company's toxic work culture during the Q3 earnings call, emphasizing fair treatment amid allegations of low salaries.

  • Infosys reported a fiscal third quarter profit of ₹6,806 crore, up 11.46% YoY.
  • Parekh responded to allegations of insufficient salary hikes and a poor work culture during the earnings call.
  • Concerns escalated after comments from founder Narayana Murthy about young employees working excessive hours.
  • Many former employees have accused Infosys of underpaying staff, particularly fresh graduates.
  • Parekh insists that Infosys maintains a fair treatment policy for all employees.
  • The company is on track to hire around 15,000 freshers in FY25.
“In terms of the employee question, within Infosys we have a very clear approach to make sure that everyone is treated fairly.” - Salil Parekh

The discussion highlights ongoing challenges at Infosys concerning employee satisfaction, attracting new talent, and maintaining a positive work environment.

Key headlines from the market include:

The market's outlook remains cautious as investors await more data and reactions to corporate earnings.

item.title: SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

SpaceX experienced a setback during its seventh test mission of the Starship rocket when contact was lost about eight minutes into the flight, leading to the destruction of the spacecraft. This test represented the first for the upgraded Starship this year.

  • The Starship lifted off from Boca Chica, Texas, on January 17, 2025, at 5:38 PM EST.
  • SpaceX lost contact eight minutes into the flight after the rocket separated from its Super Heavy booster.
  • CEO Elon Musk shared a video of the debris falling and remarked that 'entertainment is guaranteed.'
  • The mission involved testing 10 dummy satellites intended to be released in orbit.
  • This marked the first operational flight of the upgraded Starship.
"We did lose all communications with the ship - that is essentially telling us we had an anomaly with the upper stage." - Dan Huot, SpaceX Communications Manager

This test flight highlights the ongoing challenges SpaceX faces in achieving reliable space travel, as well as the ambitious goals set forth by Elon Musk for future missions.
